desc: This foundation course explores major principles of cellular and molecular biology and is a prerequisite for all Level II biology courses. Emphases include the structural and chemical composition of cells, crucial metabolic pathways, fundamentals of cell division, basic genetics, and the scientific method. Materials integrate concepts with problem-solving. Students are introduced to state-of-the-art library search technologies and scientific writing. Students attend lectures plus one 2.5-hour laboratory per week. Offered Fall Semester and during Interim.
name: Cell Bio & Genetics
notes: Students in Bio 125 must also register for one lab Bio 125 AL or BL. This course has class-year limits.
title: Cellular Biology and Genetics
